Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntitySuiteInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Projectile, Ship

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntitySuiteInterface
    This abstract class defines what an entity is. An entity is any object that moves around the screen, and can be collided with. Most commonly, an entity is a form of projectile, or a ship.
    Author:
    Andrew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(java.lang.String ref, double x, double y)
      The constructor this entity.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void detectCollision(Entity entB)
      This method is called by the GameEngine object to detect a collison for each entity.
      void disable()
      Disables the entity, which is then deleted from the entity cache and garbage collected after one game loop cycle
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2D, float interp)
      The method for drawing this entity, draws both the sprite and the bounding boxes, if that portion of the code is not commented out
      void enable()
      Enables this entity, not currently used, as all entities are enabled by default

      Gets the height of the bounding box for this entity.

      Gets the width of the sprite object associated with this entity.

      Gets the Y coordinate of this entity.

      Hides this entity.

      Checks whether this entity is enabled.

      Returns whether this entity is visible.
      void move()
      This method moves the entity using a Vector2D object.
      void pickDestination()
      This method is called every tick, and checks to see whether the entity has arrived at is destination, within a certain tolerance (in order to prevent mistakes, or circling around a destination).
      void rotateBoundingBox()
      A method to rotate the bounding box of this entity.
      void setTheta(double theta)
      Sets the current theta value for this entity.

      This method sets the X coordinate of this entity.
      void setYPos(double yPos)
      This method sets the Y coordinate of this entity.
      void show()
      Sets the visibility of this entity to true so that it can be rendered
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void update()
      The update method of this entity, currently all it does is call the move() method, and if the entity is not a player or a projectile, attempts to shoot (because this makes the assumption that the only other entities other than projectiles and player ships are enemy ships).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(java.lang.String ref,
      double x,
      double y)
        The constructor this entity. Takes a filename for the image of the sprite, and the starting x and y coordinates in the viewable area
        Parameters:
        ref - The name of the image in the ~/sprites folder, without the .png extension
        x - The starting X coordinate for this entity
        y - The starting Y coordinate for this entity

    • Method Detail

      • detectCollision

        public void detectCollision(Entity entB)
        Description copied from interface: EntitySuiteInterface
        This method is called by the GameEngine object to detect a collison for each entity.
        Specified by:
        detectCollision in interface EntitySuiteInterface
        Parameters:
        entB - the entity that is to be checked for collisions with other entities.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables the entity, which is then deleted from the entity cache and garbage collected after one game loop cycle

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2D,
        float interp)
        The method for drawing this entity, draws both the sprite and the bounding boxes, if that portion of the code is not commented out
        Specified by:
        draw in interface EntitySuiteInterface

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables this entity, not currently used, as all entities are enabled by default

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Gets the height of the bounding box for this entity. Used quite a lot for targeting specific parts of the ship etc, as the bounding box dimensions can be used to determine a position relative to the XY position of this entity
        Returns:
        the height of the bounding box for this entity

      • getLastX

        public double getLastX()
        Used for interpolation purposes
        Returns:
        the lastXposition of this entity

      • getLastY

        public double getLastY()
        Used for interpolation purposes.
        Returns:
        the last Y position of this entity

      • getTheta

        public double getTheta()
        Returns the current theta value for this entity. This corresponds to the total rotation of the object.
        Returns:
        the theta value associated with this object

      • getWidth

        public double getWidth()
        Gets the width of the sprite object associated with this entity.
        Returns:
        the width of the sprite

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Gets the X coordinate of this entity. The X coordinate is defined as the left side of the sprite.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of this entity

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets the Y coordinate of this entity. The Y coordinate is defined as the top side of the sprite.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of this entity

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hides this entity. All hidden entities are not rendered in the viewable area, but are not disabled. Likely a good implementation when a world map is introduced and the entity is off screen.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Checks whether this entity is enabled. All enabled entities are updated when updateGameLogic() is called in the game engine.
        Returns:
        isEnabled Whether this entity is enabled

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether this entity is visible. Visible entities are rendered to the screen.
        Returns:
        isVisible Whether this entity is visible on the screen

      • move

        public void move()
        This method moves the entity using a Vector2D object. Furthermore, an AffineTransform object translates the entitys bounding box.

      • pickDestination

        public void pickDestination()
        This method is called every tick, and checks to see whether the entity has arrived at is destination, within a certain tolerance (in order to prevent mistakes, or circling around a destination). If the entity has arrived at its destination, then it randomly picks a new destination within the current boundary of the visible game window.

      • rotateBoundingBox

        public void rotateBoundingBox()
        A method to rotate the bounding box of this entity. Not currently implemented.

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double theta)
        Sets the current theta value for this entity. Currently it is used by the movement vector to determine which direction the entity should face, and is also used to determine at what angle the entity should be drawn.
        Parameters:
        theta - the theta to set

      • setXPos

        public void setXPos(double xPos)
        This method sets the X coordinate of this entity. This method is called by the Vector2D objects' step() method each cycle.
        Parameters:
        xPos - the xPos to set

      • setYPos

        public void setYPos(double yPos)
        This method sets the Y coordinate of this entity. This method is called by the Vector2D objects' step() method each cycle.
        Parameters:
        yPos - the yPos to set

      • show

        public void show()
        Sets the visibility of this entity to true so that it can be rendered

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • update

        public void update()
        The update method of this entity, currently all it does is call the move() method, and if the entity is not a player or a projectile, attempts to shoot (because this makes the assumption that the only other entities other than projectiles and player ships are enemy ships).
        Specified by:
        update in interface EntitySuiteInterface
